conclusion: Liquid flows into the system from points A, B, C, and D, each releasing a different color of liquid.
The liquids follow paths through the various channels and barriers, mixing as they travel through the system.
The barriers redirect the flow of the liquid toward the bottom containers, mixing and following the paths created by the barriers.
The liquids mix as they pass through the barriers, creating colorful streaks, and are directed into different paths, resulting in a mixture of colors.
The mixture of liquids flows into the bottom containers E and F.
The liquid will flow into both containers E and F after passing through the baffles.
